channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Perplexity said to submit bid to merge with TikTok’s US unit
item.description: TikTok’s China-based parent company is required to find a buyer for its US operations or face a shutdown on Sunday under the law.

item.title: Israel and Palestinians Prepare for Long-Sought Truce in Gaza
item.description: Qatar, which mediated the agreement, said the cease-fire deal was set to begin at 8:30 a.m. local time on Sunday.

item.title: TikTok Starts Going Dark in the U.S.
item.description: The popular video app stopped working shortly before a federal law barring U.S. companies from hosting or distributing TikTok was set to take effect o...

item.title: Trump’s Return Has Unnerved World Leaders. But Not India.
item.description: An upward trajectory in relations is “almost inevitable,” the U.S. ambassador, Eric Garcetti, said in an interview before leaving his post.

item.title: Real estate brokers seek special exemptions from LA’s ‘mansion tax’ and key rules to spur rebuilding after wildfires
item.description: "The City should not impose taxes on individuals who lost their homes in the fires."

item.title: US TikTok users lose access to app ahead of Sunday deadline
item.description: “A law banning TikTok has been enacted in the U.S.,” according to an in-app pop-up message. “Unfortunately, that means you can’t use TikTok for now.”

item.title: What if No One Misses TikTok?
item.description: TikTok’s cultural footprint in America is huge. Why is its disappearance being met with a shrug?

item.title: Trump’s Return Has Unnerved World Leaders. But Not India.
item.description: An upward trajectory in relations is “almost inevitable,” the U.S. ambassador, Eric Garcetti, said in an interview before leaving his post.

item.title: These Rooms Give Young Indian Lovers Rare Privacy. Cue the Complaints.
item.description: A policy change by a popular hotel platform shows the tension between traditional values and modern ideals in India.

item.title: Inside South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol’s Life in Jail
item.description: President Yoon Suk Yeol, a former prosecutor, used to put people in jail. Now, after his formal arrest, he himself is in a cell, alone.

item.title: Sam Altman says the kid he’s expecting soon will never be smarter than AI, but thinks this ability will be valuable
item.description: "And of course it's smarter than us. Of course, it can do things we can't, but also who really cares? I think it's only weird for us in this one trans...

item.title: These Rooms Give Young Indian Lovers Rare Privacy. Cue the Complaints.
item.description: A policy change by a popular hotel platform shows the tension between traditional values and modern ideals in India.

item.title: How Antony Blinken, America’s Top Diplomat, Became the Secretary of War
item.description: President Biden’s longtime aide rallied scores of nations to defend Ukraine, but then became a villain to the many critics of U.S. support for Israel’...

item.title: In TikTok’s Final Hours, Users React to a Nationwide Ban of the App
item.description: Users in the United States react to a nationwide ban of the app.

item.title: Trump says he ‘most likely’ will give TikTok a 90-day extension to avoid US ban
item.description: “If I decide to do that, I’ll probably announce it on Monday,” he said.
